clinical_note.text: SUBJECTIVE: Patient is a 60-year-old female presenting for a routine screening evaluation. She reports no specific health concerns today. No breast pain, nipple discharge, or self-palpated masses. No family history of breast or ovarian cancer. OBJECTIVE: Vital signs: BP 122/78, HR 70, Temp 98.6. Physical Exam: Well-appearing female in no acute distress. Chest/Breasts: Symmetric, no skin changes, no nipple retraction. No masses or axillary lymphadenopathy noted on manual palpation. ASSESSMENT: Healthy 60-year-old female due for age-appropriate health maintenance. PLAN: Order routine screening mammogram (last performed >2 years ago). Return for follow-up once results are available.

orders.failure_reason: Patient not yet scheduled for follow-up

results.full_text: FINDINGS: There is a 1.2 cm pleomorphic microcalcification cluster in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast. No significant findings in the right breast. IMPRESSION: Suspicious finding in the left breast. RECOMMENDATION: Ultrasound-guided core needle biopsy. BIRADS 4: Suspicious. The report has been transmitted to the ordering physician's portal.

diagnostic_hypothesis.reasoning: The presence of a BIRADS 4 pleomorphic microcalcification cluster carries a high probability of malignancy (range 2% to 95%), necessitating immediate tissue sampling to confirm or rule out invasive ductal carcinoma or DCIS.

ai_should_flag: Critical abnormal result unread by provider
High-risk BIRADS score (4) requires urgent referral
Negative clinical exam discordant with imaging findings
